tour.title: Bugs

screen.title: Searching for bugs
screen.summary: Anyone can search, view and comment on tens of thousands of bugs filed in Launchpad.
screen.callout: Search bugs filed against hundreds of projects and packages.
Get a snapshot of issues currently affecting Launchpad communities.
And see which issues have recently been solved.

screen.title: Viewing a bug
screen.summary: Individual bug pages show how a bug affects other communities, who is working on the bug and what discussion has taken place.
screen.callout: You can track a bug's status across different communities, even if they use external bug trackers.
See which individual or team each community has assigned to work on a bug. Or link to the bug in an external tracker.
If other projects or distributions are affected by this bug, sharing it with them takes just a few clicks.
Any Launchpad user or team can subscribe to a bug, giving them email notification of status changes and new comments.

screen.title: Listing project bugs
screen.summary: A project's bug listing gives a quick overview of how many issues are outstanding.
screen.callout: Coloured bug icons make it easy to see how important the project considers each bug to be.
A yellow Bazaar icon shows that a bug is linked to a branch of code that is intended to fix it.
Tags help communities spontaneously categorise their bugs.

screen.title: Assigning a bug
screen.summary: Launchpad makes it easy to keep bug reports up to date.
screen.callout: Each community affected by a bug can choose their own assignee and status, but all communities share the same comment history.
Quick-links to that community's bug contact and the current user, speed up bug assignment.
